New Records: The Chicago White Sox are flirting with the record for most losses in a single season, which is 120, set by the expansion New York Mets in 1962.
Key Match Events: The Los Angeles Angels won 4-3 in 13 innings against the Chicago White Sox, dropping the White Sox record to 36-117.
Pre-Game Insights: Chicago White Sox general manager Chris Getz said he wasn't surprised that the team was flirting with the record for most losses in a season, but he remains upbeat about the team's future.
Post-Match Reflections: Interim manager Grady Sizemore didn't comment on the team's performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox tied the American League record with 21 losses in a row this summer.
Others: No player on the current roster who has amassed over 45 at-bats is hitting over.250, and no pitcher has double digits in wins.
